derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: probably of Scandinavian origin and related to Swedish drägg (plural)

entry.def: The dregs of a liquid are the last drops left at the bottom of a container, together with any solid bits that have sunk to the bottom.

example.ex: Colum drained the dregs from his cup.
example.tran: 科拉姆将杯中所剩一饮而尽。

entry.def: If you talk about the dregs of society or of a community, you mean the people in it who you consider to be the most worthless and bad.

example.ex: He sees dissidents as the dregs of society.
example.tran: 他把和他政见相左的人看作是社会渣滓。

means.word_mean: 1. sediment that has settled at the bottom of a liquid

sentences.en: Dregs settled at the bottom of the container.
sentences.cn: 渣滓沉淀在容器的底部。
